wikipedia_page.main: Samuel Turner VC (February 1826 – 13 June 1868) was an English recipient of the Victoria Cross, the highest and most prestigious award for gallantry in the face of the enemy that can be awarded to British and Commonwealth forces.

link_mentions.page: List of English Victoria Cross recipients
response: |Samuel Turner || British Army || 1857 || Indian Mutiny || Delhi
*Samuel Turner, recipient of the Victoria Cross
* Samuel Turner (Royalist) (died c. 1647), physician and Royalist during the English Civil War
* Samuel Turner (informer) (1765–1807), Irish barrister, Protestant supporter of the United Irishmen who turned informer
* Samuel Turner (VC) (1826–1868), English soldier decorated for valour during the Indian Mutiny
